refnamediv.refpurpose: Base class for the GStreamer object hierarchy

refsect1.title: Object Hierarchy
refsect1.screen: GObject ╰── GInitiallyUnowned ╰── GstObject ├── GstAllocator ├── GstPad ├── GstPadTemplate ├── GstPluginFeature ├── GstElement ├── GstBus ├── GstTask ├── GstTaskPool ├── GstClock ├── GstControlBinding ├── GstControlSource ├── GstPlugin ├── GstRegistry ╰── GstBufferPool

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GstObject provides a root for the object hierarchy tree filed in by the GStreamer library. It is currently a thin wrapper on top of GInitiallyUnowned. It is an abstract class that is not very usable on its own.

GstObject gives us basic refcounting, parenting functionality and locking. Most of the functions are just extended for special GStreamer needs and can be found under the same name in the base class of GstObject which is GObject (e.g. g_object_ref() becomes gst_object_ref()).

Since GstObject derives from GInitiallyUnowned, it also inherits the floating reference. Be aware that functions such as gst_bin_add() and gst_element_add_pad() take ownership of the floating reference.
In contrast to GObject instances, GstObject adds a name property. The functions gst_object_set_name() and gst_object_get_name() are used to set/get the name of the object.

refsect2.title: controlled properties
GST_OBJECT_FLAGS()
refsect2.para: This macro returns the entire set of flags for the object.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_FLAG_IS_SET()
refsect2.para: This macro checks to see if the given flag is set.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_FLAG_SET()
refsect2.para: This macro sets the given bits.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_FLAG_UNSET()
refsect2.para: This macro unsets the given bits.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_NAME()
refsect2.para: Get the name of this object

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_PARENT()
refsect2.para: Get the parent of this object

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_REFCOUNT()
refsect2.para: Get access to the reference count field of the object.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_REFCOUNT_VALUE()
refsect2.para: Get the reference count value of the object.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_LOCK()
refsect2.para: This macro will obtain a lock on the object, making serialization possible. It blocks until the lock can be obtained.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_TRYLOCK()
refsect2.para: This macro will try to obtain a lock on the object, but will return with FALSE if it can't get it immediately.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_UNLOCK()
refsect2.para: This macro releases a lock on the object.

refsect2.title: GST_OBJECT_GET_LOCK()
refsect2.para: Acquire a reference to the mutex of this object.

refsect2.title: gst_object_set_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the name of object , or gives object a guaranteed unique name (if name is NULL). This function makes a copy of the provided name, so the caller retains ownership of the name it sent.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the name could be set. Since Objects that have a parent cannot be renamed, this function returns FALSE in those cases.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases object 's LOCK.

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Returns a copy of the name of object . Caller should g_free() the return value after usage. For a nameless object, this returns NULL, which you can safely g_free() as well.
Free-function: g_free

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the name of object . g_free() after usage.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases object 's LOCK.

refsect2.title: gst_object_set_parent ()
refsect2.para: Sets the parent of object to parent . The object's reference count will be incremented, and any floating reference will be removed (see gst_object_ref_sink()).

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if parent could be set or FALSE when object already had a parent or object and parent are the same.
MT safe. Grabs and releases object 's LOCK.

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_parent ()
refsect2.para: Returns the parent of object . This function increases the refcount of the parent object so you should gst_object_unref() it after usage.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: parent of object , this can be NULL if object has no parent. unref after usage.
MT safe. Grabs and releases object 's LOCK.

refsect2.title: gst_object_has_as_parent ()
refsect2.para: Check if parent is the parent of object . E.g. a GstElement can check if it owns a given GstPad.

entry.para: a GstObject to check as parent

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: FALSE if either object or parent is NULL. TRUE if parent is the parent of object . Otherwise FALSE.
MT safe. Grabs and releases object 's locks.

refsect2.para: Since: 1.6

refsect2.title: gst_object_unparent ()
refsect2.para: Clear the parent of object , removing the associated reference. This function decreases the refcount of object .
MT safe. Grabs and releases object 's lock.

refsect2.title: gst_object_default_deep_notify ()
refsect2.para: A default deep_notify signal callback for an object. The user data should contain a pointer to an array of strings that should be excluded from the notify. The default handler will print the new value of the property using g_print.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases object 's LOCK for getting its path string.

entry.para: the GObject that signalled the notify.
a GstObject that initiated the notify.
a set of user-specified properties to exclude or NULL to show all changes.

refsect2.title: gst_object_default_error ()
refsect2.para: A default error function that uses g_printerr() to display the error message and the optional debug sting..
The default handler will simply print the error string using g_print.

entry.para: the GstObject that initiated the error.
an additional debug information string, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gst_object_check_uniqueness ()
refsect2.para: Checks to see if there is any object named name in list . This function does not do any locking of any kind. You might want to protect the provided list with the lock of the owner of the list. This function will lock each GstObject in the list to compare the name, so be careful when passing a list with a locked object.

entry.para: a list of GstObject to check through.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if a GstObject named name does not appear in list , FALSE if it does.
MT safe. Grabs and releases the LOCK of each object in the list.

refsect2.title: gst_object_has_as_ancestor ()
refsect2.para: Check if object has an ancestor ancestor somewhere up in the hierarchy. One can e.g. check if a GstElement is inside a GstPipeline.

entry.para: a GstObject to check as ancestor

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if ancestor is an ancestor of object .
MT safe. Grabs and releases object 's locks.

refsect2.title: gst_object_has_ancestor ()

warning.para: gst_object_has_ancestor is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.
MT safe. Grabs and releases object 's locks.

refsect2.para: Check if object has an ancestor ancestor somewhere up in the hierarchy. One can e.g. check if a GstElement is inside a GstPipeline.

entry.para: a GstObject to check as ancestor

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if ancestor is an ancestor of object .

refsect2.title: gst_object_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increments the reference count on object . This function does not take the lock on object because it relies on atomic refcounting.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A pointer to object .

refsect2.title: gst_object_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrements the reference count on object . If reference count hits zero, destroy object . This function does not take the lock on object as it relies on atomic refcounting.
The unref method should never be called with the LOCK held since this might deadlock the dispose function.

refsect2.title: gst_object_ref_sink ()
refsect2.para: Increase the reference count of object , and possibly remove the floating reference, if object has a floating reference.

In other words, if the object is floating, then this call "assumes ownership" of the floating reference, converting it to a normal reference by clearing the floating flag while leaving the reference count unchanged. If the object is not floating, then this call adds a new normal reference increasing the reference count by one.

refsect2.title: gst_object_replace ()
refsect2.para: Atomically modifies a pointer to point to a new object. The reference count of oldobj is decreased and the reference count of newobj is increased.
Either newobj and the value pointed to by oldobj may be NULL.

entry.para: pointer to a place of a GstObject to replace.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if newobj was different from oldobj

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_path_string ()
refsect2.para: Generates a string describing the path of object in the object hierarchy. Only useful (or used) for debugging.
Free-function: g_free

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string describing the path of object . You must g_free() the string after usage.
MT safe. Grabs and releases the GstObject's LOCK for all objects in the hierarchy.

refsect2.title: gst_object_suggest_next_sync ()
refsect2.para: Returns a suggestion for timestamps where buffers should be split to get best controller results.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Returns the suggested timestamp or GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE if no control-rate was set.

refsect2.title: gst_object_sync_values ()
refsect2.para: Sets the properties of the object, according to the GstControlSources that (maybe) handle them and for the given timestamp.
If this function fails, it is most likely the application developers fault. Most probably the control sources are not setup correctly.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties
the time that should be processed

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the controller values could be applied to the object properties, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gst_object_has_active_control_bindings ()
refsect2.para: Check if the object has an active controlled properties.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the object has active controlled properties

refsect2.title: gst_object_set_control_bindings_disabled ()
refsect2.para: This function is used to disable all controlled properties of the object for some time, i.e. gst_object_sync_values() will do nothing.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties
boolean that specifies whether to disable the controller or not.

refsect2.title: gst_object_set_control_binding_disabled ()
refsect2.para: This function is used to disable the control bindings on a property for some time, i.e. gst_object_sync_values() will do nothing for the property.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties
boolean that specifies whether to disable the controller or not.

refsect2.title: gst_object_add_control_binding ()
refsect2.para: Attach the GstControlBinding to the object. If there already was a GstControlBinding for this property it will be replaced.
The object will take ownership of the binding .

entry.para: the GstControlBinding that should be used.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: FALSE if the given binding has not been setup for this object or has been setup for a non suitable property, TRUE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_control_binding ()
refsect2.para: Gets the corresponding GstControlBinding for the property. This should be unreferenced again after use.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstControlBinding for property_name or NULL if the property is not controlled.

refsect2.title: gst_object_remove_control_binding ()
refsect2.para: Removes the corresponding GstControlBinding. If it was the last ref of the binding, it will be disposed.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the binding could be removed.

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_value ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value for the given controlled property at the requested time.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties
the name of the property to get
the time the control-change should be read from

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GValue of the property at the given time, or NULL if the property isn't controlled.

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_value_array ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gst_object_get_value_array (GstObject *object, const gchar *property_name, GstClockTime timestamp, GstClockTime interval, guint n_values, gpointer values);
refsect2.para: Gets a number of values for the given controlled property starting at the requested time. The array values need to hold enough space for n_values of the same type as the objects property's type.
This function is useful if one wants to e.g. draw a graph of the control curve or apply a control curve sample by sample.
The values are unboxed and ready to be used. The similar function gst_object_get_g_value_array() returns the array as GValues and is better suites for bindings.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties
the name of the property to get
the time that should be processed
the time spacing between subsequent values

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the given array could be filled, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_g_value_array ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gst_object_get_g_value_array (GstObject *object, const gchar *property_name, GstClockTime timestamp, GstClockTime interval, guint n_values, GValue *values);
refsect2.para: Gets a number of GValues for the given controlled property starting at the requested time. The array values need to hold enough space for n_values of GValue.
This function is useful if one wants to e.g. draw a graph of the control curve or apply a control curve sample by sample.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties
the name of the property to get
the time that should be processed
the time spacing between subsequent values

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the given array could be filled, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gst_object_get_control_rate ()
refsect2.para: Obtain the control-rate for this object . Audio processing GstElement objects will use this rate to sub-divide their processing loop and call gst_object_sync_values() inbetween. The length of the processing segment should be up to control -rate nanoseconds.
If the object is not under property control, this will return GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE. This allows the element to avoid the sub-dividing.
The control-rate is not expected to change if the element is in GST_STATE_PAUSED or GST_STATE_PLAYING.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the control rate in nanoseconds

refsect2.title: gst_object_set_control_rate ()
refsect2.para: Change the control-rate for this object . Audio processing GstElement objects will use this rate to sub-divide their processing loop and call gst_object_sync_values() inbetween. The length of the processing segment should be up to control -rate nanoseconds.
The control-rate should not change if the element is in GST_STATE_PAUSED or GST_STATE_PLAYING.

entry.para: the object that has controlled properties

refsect2.title: struct GstObject
refsect2.para: GStreamer base object class.

refsect2.title: struct GstObjectClass
refsect2.para: GStreamer base object class.

refsect2.title: enum GstObjectFlags
refsect2.para: The standard flags that an gstobject may have.

entry.para: subclasses can add additional flags starting from this flag

refsect2.title: The name property
refsect2.para: The name of the object.
Flags: Read / Write / Construct
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The parent property
refsect2.para: The parent of the object. Please note, that when changing the 'parent' property, we don't emit notify and deep-notify signals due to locking issues. In some cases one can use element-added or element-removed signals on the parent to achieve a similar effect.
Flags: Read / Write

refsect2.title: The deep-notify signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstObject *gstobject, GstObject *prop_object, GParamSpec *prop, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: The deep notify signal is used to be notified of property changes. It is typically attached to the toplevel bin to receive notifications from all the elements contained in that bin.

entry.para: the object that originated the signal

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: No Hooks
